text: The word of the Lord that came to Joel son of Pethuel:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear this, O elders;
    give ear, all inhabitants of the land!
Has such a thing happened in your days
    or in the days of your ancestors?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tell your children of it,
    and let your children tell their children,
    and their children another generation.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Wake up, you drunkards, and weep,
    and wail, all you wine drinkers,
over the sweet wine,
    for it is cut off from your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a nation has invaded my land,
    powerful and innumerable;
its teeth are lions’ teeth,
    and it has the fangs of a lioness.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Lament like a virgin dressed in sackcloth
    for the husband of her youth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The grain offering and the drink offering are cut off
    from the house of the Lord.
The priests mourn,
    the ministers of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fields are devastated,
    the ground mourns,
for the grain is destroyed,
    the wine dries up,
    the oil fails.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be dismayed, you farmers;
    wail, you vinedressers,
over the wheat and the barley,
    for the crops of the field are ruined.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Put on sackcloth and lament, you priests;
    wail, you ministers of the altar.
Come, pass the night in sackcloth,
    you ministers of my God!
Grain offering and drink offering
    are withheld from the house of your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consecrate a fast;
    call a solemn assembly.
Gather the elders
    and all the inhabitants of the land
to the house of the Lord your God,
    and cry out to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Alas for the day!
For the day of the Lord is near,
    and as destruction from the Almighty it comes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is not the food cut off
    before our eyes,
joy and gladness
    from the house of our God?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
How the animals groan!
    The herds of cattle wander about
because there is no pasture for them;
    even the flocks of sheep are perishing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To you, O Lord, I cry,
for fire has devoured
    the pastures of the wilderness,
and flames have burned
    all the trees of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even the wild animals cry to you
    because the watercourses are dried up,
and fire has devoured
    the pastures of the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blow the trumpet in Zion;
    sound the alarm on my holy mountain!
Let all the inhabitants of the land tremble,
    for the day of the Lord is coming, it is near—
speaker: Narrator

text:
a day of darkness and gloom,
    a day of clouds and thick darkness!
Like blackness spread upon the mountains,
    a great and powerful army comes;
their like has never been from of old,
    nor will be again after them
    in ages to come.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fire devours in front of them,
    and behind them a flame burns.
Before them the land is like the garden of Eden,
    but after them a desolate wilderness,
    and nothing escapes them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have the appearance of horses,
    and like war horses they charge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As with the rumbling of chariots,
    they leap on the tops of the mountains,
like the crackling of a flame of fire
    devouring the stubble,
like a powerful army
    drawn up for battle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before them peoples are in anguish;
    all faces grow pale.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
The earth quakes before them;
    the heavens tremble.
The sun and the moon are darkened,
    and the stars withdraw their shining.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord utters his voice
    at the head of his army;
how vast is his host!
    Numberless are those who obey his command.
Truly the day of the Lord is great,
    terrible indeed—who can endure it?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
rend your hearts and not your clothing.
Return to the Lord your God,
    for he is gracious and merciful,
slow to anger, abounding in steadfast love,
    and relenting from punishment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who knows whether he will not turn and relent
    and leave a blessing behind him,
a grain offering and a drink offering
    for the Lord your God?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
gather the people.
Consecrate the congregation;
    assemble the aged;
gather the children,
    even infants at the breast.
Let the bridegroom leave his room
    and the bride her canopy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Between the vestibule and the altar,
    let the priests, the ministers of the Lord, weep.
Let them say, “Spare your people, O Lord,
    and do not make your heritage a mockery,
    a byword among the nations.
Why should it be said among the peoples,
    ‘Where is their God?’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the Lord became jealous for his land
    and had pity on his people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In response to his people the Lord said:
“I am sending you
    grain, wine, and oil,
    and you will be satisfied;
and I will no more make you
    a mockery among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will remove the northern army far from you
    and drive it into a parched and desolate land,
its front into the eastern sea
    and its rear into the western sea;
its stench and foul smell will rise up.”
    Surely he has done great things!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
O children of Zion, be glad,
    and rejoice in the Lord your God,
for he has given the early rain for your vindication;
    he has poured down for you abundant rain,
    the early and the later rain, as before.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The threshing floors shall be full of grain;
    the vats shall overflow with wine and oil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will repay you for the years
    that the swarming locust has eaten,
the hopper, the destroyer, and the cutter,
    my great army that I sent against you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You shall eat in plenty and be satisfied
    and praise the name of the Lord your God,
    who has dealt wondrously with you.
And my people shall never again be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You shall know that I am in the midst of Israel
    and that I, the Lord, am your God and there is no other.
And my people shall never again be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then afterward
    I will pour out my spirit on all flesh;
your sons and your daughters shall prophesy,
    your old men shall dream dreams,
    and your young men shall see visions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even on the male and female slaves,
    in those days I will pour out my spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will show portents in the heavens and on the earth, blood and fire and columns of smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sun shall be turned to darkness and the moon to blood, before the great and terrible day of the Lord comes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then everyone who calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved, for in Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there shall be those who escape, as the Lord has said, and among the survivors shall be those whom the Lord calls.
speaker: Narrator

text: For then, in those days and at that time, when I restore the fortunes of Judah and Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: I will gather all the nations and bring them down to the valley of Jehoshaphat, and I will enter into judgment with them there, on account of my people and my heritage Israel, because they have scattered them among the nations. They have divided my land
speaker: Narrator

text: and cast lots for my people and traded boys for prostitutes and sold girls for wine and drunk it down.
speaker: Narrator

text: What are you to me, O Tyre and Sidon, and all the regions of Philistia? Are you paying me back for something? If you are paying me back, I will turn your deeds back upon your own heads swiftly and speedily.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you have taken my silver and my gold and have carried my rich treasures into your temples.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have sold the people of Judah and Jerusalem to the Greeks, removing them far from their own border.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now I will rouse them to leave the places to which you have sold them, and I will turn your deeds back upon your own heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will sell your sons and your daughters into the hand of the people of Judah, and they will sell them to the Sabeans, to a nation far away, for the Lord has spoken.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Come quickly,
    all you nations all around;
    gather yourselves there.
Bring down your warriors, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the nations rouse themselves
    and come up to the valley of Jehoshaphat,
for there I will sit to judge
    all the neighboring nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Put in the sickle,
    for the harvest is ripe.
Go in, tread,
    for the winepress is full.
The vats overflow,
    for their wickedness is great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Multitudes, multitudes,
    in the valley of decision!
For the day of the Lord is near
    in the valley of decision.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun and the moon are darkened,
    and the stars withdraw their shining.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord roars from Zion
    and utters his voice from Jerusalem,
    and the heavens and the earth shake.
But the Lord is a refuge for his people,
    a stronghold for the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So you shall know that I, the Lord your God,
    dwell in Zion, my holy mountain.
And Jerusalem shall be holy,
    and strangers shall never again pass through it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In that day
the mountains shall drip sweet wine,
    the hills shall flow with milk,
and all the streambeds of Judah
    shall flow with water;
a fountain shall come forth from the house of the Lord
    and water the Wadi Shittim.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Egypt shall become a desolation
    and Edom a desolate wilderness,
because of the violence done to the people of Judah,
    in whose land they have shed innocent blood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Judah shall be inhabited forever
    and Jerusalem to all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will avenge their blood, and I will not clear the guilty,
    for the Lord dwells in Zion.
speaker: Narrator
